intro: Sagraea heteronervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined sagraea, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in regions such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are lanceolate, with prominent parallel veins that give it its scientific name. Sagraea heteronervis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
